problem.p: Very large or very small numbers are best input with exponential notation. For instance, the number 8000000 (eight million) is equal to \(8 \times 10^{6}\). In this course, you can enter that as either 8 * 10 ^ 6 or as 8e6 in these problems. Try out exponential notation in the question below.

numericalresponse.label: One gigajoule is equal to 947817 British thermal units. Enter this number below in exponential notation.
numericalresponse.description: The tolerance on this question is 5%.

formulaequationinput.label: What is one light year in kilometers?

div.p: You can answer 9.48e5, or 9.48 * 10 ^ 5, or even 948e3. In addition, this problem gives partial credit for some specific alternate answers! Try answering 9.48e4 or 9.48e6 to see what happens.
